MYrecipes.ingredients:
1 cup self-rising flour,
 Â¼ teaspoon baking powder,
 4 (6 ounce) cod fillets,
 1 cup lager-style beer,
 2 cups vegetable oil for frying
MYrecipes.steps:
Step 1. Whisk flour and baking powder together and put on plate.
 Step 2. Pat fish as dry as possible. Cut pieces lengthwise to get eight 1-inch thick strips. Dust fish lightly with flour mixture and shake off excess.
 Step 3. Heat oil in a deep-fryer to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). 
 Step 4. Pour beer into the flour mixture and whisk, adding more as needed, until batter is the consistency of thick pancake batter. Dip fish pieces into the batter to coat; lift out and let excess drip off.
 Step 4. Fry fish in batches until golden brown, dunking occasionally if needed, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately.
